title: Find the Standard Deviation when Given the Z-score
question_text:
One of the values in a normal distribution is $24$ and its z-score is $1.37$.
If the mean of the distribution is $20$, what is the approximate standard deviation of the distribution?
solution:
If $x$ is an observation from a normal distribution with a known mean and standard deviation, the z-score of $x$ is:

$$z=\dfrac { \text{x}-\text{mean }}{ \text{standard deviation} } $$

1) Substitute the values into the formula:

$$1.37=\dfrac { 24-20 }{ \sigma }$$

2) Solve for the standard deviation:

$$1.37=\dfrac { 24-20 }{ \sigma } $$

$$ 1.37\sigma =4$$

$$ \sigma =\dfrac { 4 }{ 1.37 } $$

$$ \sigma=2.92$$

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect as $20$ and $24$ were incorrectly placed in the numerator.

Choice 'B' is incorrect as this is $\dfrac { -1.37 }{ 4 }$.

Choice 'C' is incorrect as this is $\dfrac { 1.37 }{ 4 }$.

Choice 'E' is incorrect as this is $4\cdot 1.37$.
